item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:

or repackaging deltascape by hand fudgein retard

rofl fudge off

i still can’t believe i did that
[/quote]

Where can i find some good information on the for statements or maybe loops i believe their called? example: for (int j = 0 > 30 + d = i++)[/quote]
The same place you can find information on all things java related?
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/for.html

Read full topic

item.title: Learned something new!
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:16, topic:554671”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=673596.msg4503907#msg4503907 date=1454878268]
Good stuff, just try and skew away from loads of if statements like that. If you have let’s say, 500 cars in the race, are you going to have 500 if statements and 500 separate variables? Thinking about these problems and how to overcome them is also a step in the right direction.
[/quote]

I do have a question, how would i go about doing this part i was thinking array’s or enums?[/quote]
Arrays and Loops would be the next step if you’re looking to avoid those mass if statements

Read full topic

item.title: Learned something new!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I remember that click.

There was never really one with web design because it’s pretty clean-cut and simple but when it came to PHP I had been grinding at trying to learn it for about 3 months (bearing in mind this was many many years ago) and I just couldn’t do it. Then I discovered how to properly use a loop to echo database contents and from there on everything seemed to make sense. You get a great sense of achievement when you finish a big project, welcome to the real world tank nation!

Keep learning and make sure to always refer to the proper practices.

Read full topic

item.title: Learned something new!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I remember that click, it’s like a sudden realization and you start to see how it all fits together and these aren’t just a bunch of magic words. Like Tree said, it will get very rewarding seeing your ideas coming to life. You’ll notice your problem solving skills advancing quickly and soon enough you’ll be writing entire systems before you even touch your keyboard.

tank nation:

Yeah i like coding like this the only reason i have a hard time with the actual rsps i’m updating ect… is because i don’t know all of the int’s, booleans, ect… which kinda makes it confusing to what i need to use when creating a method or class. Like i’m not ever sure how to look for something i wanna use when i see a method or some type of coding like “For” statements.

It’s simpler than it looks really, is there anything you need clarification on?

Read full topic

item.title: Learned something new!
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:6, topic:554671”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673596.msg4503935#msg4503935 date=1454899747]

I can very much now say java is actually more fun to learn rather than trying to guess at a problem you have. If you literally learn to write code you will enjoy your server a lot more than you have before

Glad you finally listened.
[/quote]

Yeah i like coding like this the only reason i have a hard time with the actual rsps i’m updating ect… is because i don’t know all of the int’s, booleans, ect… which kinda makes it confusing to what i need to use when creating a method or class. Like i’m not ever sure how to look for something i wanna use when i see a method or some type of coding like “For” statements.[/quote]

I’m glad you caught on. Most people never do. Welcome to one of the most exciting fields of study around. There’s nothing more rewarding than creating something out of nothing. Once you start learning, you never want it to end and it never does.

Read full topic

item.title: Learned something new!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

I can very much now say java is actually more fun to learn rather than trying to guess at a problem you have. If you literally learn to write code you will enjoy your server a lot more than you have before here’s something i came up with on my own. Reason being is because my fiance’ loves mustangs so i did an experiment with them.

[code]public class oldCars {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	
	int redMustang = 1;
	int blueMustang = 0;
	int greenMustang = 0;
	
	int firstPlace = 1;
	int secondPlace = 2;
	int thirdPlace = 3;
	
	if (redMustang >= 1) {
		System.out.println("You have won first place in the race!");
	}
    else if (blueMustang >=2) {
	System.out.println("you have won second place in the race!");
}
    else if (greenMustang >=3) {
    	System.out.println("You have won third place in the race!");
    }
    else
    	System.out.println("The race was a tie!");
	
	
	
	
	

}

}[/code]

Read full topic
